docs.snippet: MANCHESTER, England, June 8--Althea Gibson retained her Northern lawn tennis title today. She scored by default over Mrs. Thelma Long of Australia in the semi-finals and triumphed over Ann Shilcock of England, 6--3, 6--4, in the rain-interrupted...
docs.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, England, June 8--Althea Gibson retained her Northern lawn tennis title today. She scored by default over Mrs. Thelma Long of Australia in the semi-finals and triumphed over Ann Shilcock of England, 6--3, 6--4, in the rain-interrupted final.

headline.main: Miss Gibson Keeps British Tennis Title; MISS GIBSON KEEPS CROWN IN BRITAIN

docs.snippet: ALGIERS, Algeria, June 15-- French authorities are intensifying a diplomatic and propaganda offensive with the apparent aim of influencing opinion in the next United Nations General Assembly. The campaign constitutes a significant policy change.
docs.lead_paragraph: ALGIERS, Algeria, June 15-- French authorities are intensifying a diplomatic and propaganda offensive with the apparent aim of influencing opinion in the next United Nations General Assembly. The campaign constitutes a significant policy change.

headline.main: FRANCE CHANGES ALGERIAN POLICY; Observers Now Welcomed by Regime That Earlier Discouraged Visitors Minister Opposed Visit Other Diplomats Expected

byline.original: By THOMAS F. BRADY Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: THERE have been encouraging developments on  the international bridge front, where the United States has been taking a licking not only from the European press and players but also, far too often, at the bridge table.
